segments.text: I see the water from the sink has already created a large puddle on the floor, and it's just getting bigger and bigger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman doesn't even seem to notice, she's just standing there, drying that plate like nothing else matters.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is really going for it, trying to get as many cookies as he can from that jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl looks so excited, waiting for her turn to get a cookie, and it's kind of cute.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the stool is going to tip over any second now, and that could be really dangerous for the boy.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is just standing there, in her own little world, drying that plate like it's the most important thing in the world right now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder how long it will take for her to realize what's going on around her, if ever.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so serene and well-kept, it's a stark contrast to the mess and chaos inside the kitchen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope the children don't get into too much trouble for taking those cookies, but they really should be more careful.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is really pushing his limits, both literally and figuratively, trying to reach that cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think someone should really do something about that overflowing sink before the kitchen gets flooded and someone gets hurt.
segments.speaker: PAR
